creator: badgett@uthscsa.edu
text:
IE clients get incomplete images and other files. NS clients get no page and 
instead error that connection was reset by peer.
My access log shows 206 codes for these files.

I could only fix this by downgrading to Apache 1.3.2

This bug also described on XP box at the google newsgroup:

From: R Bowers (rbowers@surewest.net)
Subject: Connection Reset running Apache 2.0.43 on Windows XP 
Newsgroups: comp.infosystems.www.servers.ms-windows
Date: 2003-01-11 16:25:47 PST 

Bob

creator: amit_athavale@lycos.com
text:
206 error means "Partial Content" which is sent by the server as requested by
the client. I don't know in which scenarios IE or netscape sends "Range" headers
or it could be possible bug which is sending partial content when not asked by
client.

Could you send network trace (http) between client and server ?

Also please give details about your setup like :
1> Is proxy involved ?
2> Any 3rd party module used ?
3> Any special settings other than standard httpd.conf ?

Thanks

Add the Following to your configuration file:

EnableSendfile Off
EnableMMAP Off
Win32DisableAcceptex

If this does not fix the problem with incomplete images and other files, please
re-open the bug.

Thanks for using Apache!

-Paul Querna
creator: chip@force-elite.com
